title: Famous Arches Quiz
description: From triumphal arches to natural stone formations, test your knowledge of the world's most iconic arches.

questions.question: The Arc de Triomphe in Paris was commissioned by which French leader to honor his military victories?
The Gateway Arch in St. Louis, Missouri, is the tallest man-made monument in the United States. How tall is it?
The Arch of Constantine in Rome was built to commemorate which emperor's victory at the Battle of Milvian Bridge?
Delicate Arch, a freestanding natural stone arch and Utah's most famous landmark, is located in which national park?
The India Gate in New Delhi was built as a memorial to soldiers who died in which conflict?
The Marble Arch in London was originally constructed as the entrance to which royal residence?
The Arch of Titus in Rome commemorates the Roman victory in which famous siege?
The Puerta de Alcalá, a Neo-classical monument, is one of the most well-known landmarks of which European capital?
Rainbow Bridge, one of the world's largest natural stone arches, is located in which US state?
The Wellington Arch (also called Constitution Arch) in London is topped by a bronze sculpture depicting what?
The Patuxai Victory Monument, sometimes called the 'Arc de Triomphe of the East,' is located in which city?
Durdle Door, a natural limestone arch on the Jurassic Coast, is located in which English county?
The Arch of Septimius Severus in the Roman Forum was built to celebrate victories in which region?
The Azure Window, a famous natural arch that collapsed in 2017, was located on which Mediterranean island?
The Rua Augusta Arch in Lisbon, Portugal, overlooks which famous waterfront square?
